# Chief Intelligence Officer - Daily Brief
**Topic**: Latest economic and financial intelligence from major economies
**Time**: 2026/2/19 20:38

## Situation Overview
Hello everyone, welcome to the Daily News Channel. I'm your host, Joe. At this critical juncture of global economic transformation and policy shifts, major economies around the world are facing unprecedented challenges. In the following program, I will provide an in-depth analysis of 20 major events that have occurred in the past 24 hours and are poised to impact global developments. From the heated debate within the Federal Reserve regarding interest rate hikes versus cuts, to the choices made by major Asian countries regarding their economic growth models; from global auto giants collectively withdrawing from the electric vehicle boom, to the energy market turmoil triggered by the escalating tensions in the Middle East. Today's program is very detailed; we will travel to Wall Street, Tokyo, Beijing, and Brussels to reveal the political and economic logic hidden behind complex macroeconomic data. Please see the detailed report below.

## Key Intelligence
### 1. The minutes of the Fed's January meeting have been released, revealing that officials were deeply divided on the future path of interest rates.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: 路透社, 纽约时报, 彭博社, CNBC
- **Summary**: According to reports from Reuters and CNBC, the Federal Reserve released the minutes of its policy meeting at the end of January on February 18. The document revealed a clear division among policymakers regarding the path of the federal funds rate. Although the rate is currently maintained in the range of 3.5% to 3.75%, a "hawkish-dove" debate emerged within the meeting. Some officials advocated for further rate cuts if inflation continues to decline, while the other side strongly stated that if inflation remains above target, a resumption of rate hikes is not ruled out. Chairman Powell emphasized that a "meeting-by-meeting" approach will be adopted, meaning that the market will remain highly uncertain until the next policy meeting in March.
- **References**:
  - [1] [路透社](https://www.reuters.com/business/fed-minutes-could-highlight-shift-balance-risks-policymakers-put-rates-hold-2026-02-18/)
  - [2] [纽约时报](https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/18/business/economy/fed-officials-minutes-interest-rates.html)

### 2. Hawkish signals from the Federal Reserve trigger volatility: US Treasury yields rise, gold prices stabilize at high levels.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: CNBC, Trading Economics
- **Summary**: Reports indicate that global financial markets experienced significant volatility in the past 24 hours, influenced by the hawkish signals released in the Federal Reserve meeting minutes. The yield on the 10-year US Treasury note rose to 4.075%, while the 2-year yield reached 3.453%. The US dollar index remained high at 97.6. Despite market concerns about persistently high interest rates, gold remained resilient, stabilizing around $4,990 per ounce after some fluctuation. Investors are now focusing on the upcoming Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) price index, hoping to find further clues about the direction of inflation.
- **References**:
  - [1] [CNBC](https://www.cnbc.com/2026/02/18/us-treasury-yields-investors-await-fed-meeting-minutes-.html)
  - [2] [Trading Economics](https://tradingeconomics.com/commodity/gold)

### 3. China's economy is moving towards high-quality growth: focusing on the digital economy and green transformation.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: 新华社, 南华早报, 法国巴黎银行
- **Summary**: According to reports from Xinhua News Agency and the South China Morning Post, China is at a critical juncture in its economic growth model transformation. Recent policy developments indicate that China is using fiscal stimulus to prioritize support for renewable energy and digital infrastructure development. BNP Paribas analysis suggests that Chinese authorities are balancing monetary policy and regulatory measures to stabilize the real estate market and encourage technological innovation. Renowned economists suggest that China must shift its focus from pursuing "quantity" to improving "quality," tapping into its enormous domestic consumption potential by strengthening basic research and integrating the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area to address the challenges of the external export environment.
- **References**:
  - [1] [BNP Paribas](https://bitcoinworld.co.in/china-economic-slowdown-export-risks/)
  - [2] [South China Morning Post](https://www.scmp.com/asia)

### 4. The IMF urged China to shift its growth model and embrace a consumption-driven economy.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: 彭博社, 日本时报
- **Summary**: According to a Bloomberg report on February 19, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has offered new recommendations for current economic policies. The IMF believes that an over-reliance on industrial expansion and exports could lead to a waste of domestic resources and global trade frictions. The organization calls on China to reorient its policies and establish a growth model based on domestic consumption expenditure. The IMF points out that this shift would not only contribute to economic sustainability but also effectively ease tensions with global trading partners, laying the foundation for long-term stable growth.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Bloomberg](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/business/2026/02/19/economy/imf-china-economic-policies-damage/)

### 5. The United States announced the establishment of a $12 billion critical mineral reserve, aimed at breaking monopolies.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Scan TV
- **Summary**: According to the latest news received by this station, US President Trump has officially announced the establishment of a strategic reserve of critical minerals worth nearly $12 billion. This major move aims to weaken the monopoly of other countries in the global raw materials sector and ensure the security of the supply chains of US high-tech and defense industries. This plan is seen as a significant adjustment in US industrial policy, marking a new phase in the global competition for critical resources, characterized by nationally led stockpiling and strengthened supply resilience.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Scan TV](https://scantv.al/english/lajme)

### 6. Indonesia tightens nickel export restrictions, intensifying competition in the global new energy industry chain.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: BusinessMirror
- **Summary**: Data released by [BusinessMirror] shows that Indonesia, a key raw material supplier for the stainless steel and clean energy industries, is further strengthening its control over nickel resources. Faced with fierce competition between the US and China for this critical mineral, the Indonesian government's move aims to enhance its bargaining power in the global value chain. Analysts worry that the tightening of Indonesia's nickel policy could directly impact the cost and stability of related industrial chains globally, particularly in China.
- **References**:
  - [1] [BusinessMirror](https://businessmirror.com.ph/2026/02/18/indonesia-tightens-control-on-nickel-as-us-and-china-scramble-for-critical-minerals/)

### 7. Global auto giants retreat: billions of dollars in depreciation write-offs as electric vehicle boom cools down.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: 每日电讯报
- **Summary**: According to The Daily Telegraph, the global automotive industry is facing a major strategic adjustment. Due to market demand falling far short of expectations, several automotive giants are writing off billions of dollars in losses and gradually withdrawing from the previously booming electric vehicle craze. The report points out that the explosive growth momentum that was once highly anticipated has clearly weakened, and major manufacturers are reassessing their production line layouts, focusing on more stable profit models or seeking new powertrain solutions.
- **References**:
  - [1] [The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2026/02/19/even-auto-giants-know-the-electric-car-boom-out-of-charge/)

### 8. Reports suggest ECB President Christine Lagarde may be considering leaving, prompting an urgent official response to stabilize the market.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: 路透社, 金融时报, 彭博社
- **Summary**: According to Reuters and the Financial Times, recent market rumors suggest that European Central Bank (ECB) President Christine Lagarde plans to step down before her term expires in 2027, allowing French President Emmanuel Macron to participate in deciding her successor before leaving office. This political intention has raised concerns about policy continuity in the Eurozone. In response, an ECB spokesperson quickly stated that Lagarde is currently fully focused on her mission and has not yet made any decisions regarding her term. Market analysts suggest that at this delicate juncture when Eurozone inflation is nearing the 2% target, a change in the ECB president's appointment will introduce new uncertainties into monetary policy.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Reuters](https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2026/02/18/ecb-president-lagarde-plans-to-quit-before-macron039s-term-ends-ft-reports)
  - [2] [Politico](https://www.politico.eu/article/ecb-hoses-down-speculation-about-lagardes-future/)

### 9. The yen fell to a one-week low as expectations for a Bank of Japan interest rate hike continued to rise.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: 路透社, Trading Economics
- **Summary**: In other news, the yen fell to a near one-week low against the dollar in the past 24 hours, dropping to the 153.5-155 range. Despite Japan's exports posting their fastest pace in three years in January, the yen remained under pressure due to the hawkish minutes from the Federal Reserve and weaker-than-expected fourth-quarter GDP figures. A Reuters survey showed that most economists expect the Bank of Japan to raise its policy rate to 1% by the end of June, with some experts even suggesting this move could happen as early as April. The market is currently closely watching the Japan-US inflation data to be released on Friday.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Reuters](https://wkzo.com/2026/02/18/boj-to-hike-policy-rate-to-1-by-end-june-sooner-than-forecast-before-election/)
  - [2] [Trading Economics](https://tradingeconomics.com/japan/currency)

### 10. Sanae Takaichi was re-elected as Japan's prime minister, pledging to revitalize the economy and maintain fiscal discipline.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: WMBD Radio, Livemint
- **Summary**: According to our Tokyo correspondent, Sanae Takaichi has officially been re-elected as Prime Minister of Japan following her landslide victory in the election. At yesterday's press conference, Takaichi reiterated her determination to revitalize the economy and confirmed the first phase of $550 billion in investment projects in the United States. Faced with rising Japanese bond yields and pressure on the yen's depreciation, her policy rhetoric became more cautious, emphasizing "responsible fiscal policy" to win market confidence. She expressed support for the Bank of Japan's independent achievement of its inflation target and did not explicitly oppose further interest rate hikes, which is seen as leaving room for the normalization of monetary policy.
- **References**:
  - [1] [WMBD Radio](https://wmbdradio.com/2026/02/18/japan-pm-faces-challenges-selling-proactive-fiscal-policy-to-bond-vigilantes/)

### 11. The IMF released its annual consultation on the Japanese economy, recommending continued interest rate hikes and warning of potential tax adjustments.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: 国际货币基金组织 (IMF)
- **Summary**: According to the latest press conference transcript released by the IMF, the IMF held its annual Article IV consultation with Japan. The IMF delegation head stated that although Japan's inflation has been above target for three and a half consecutive years, it is stabilizing and is expected to return to the ideal level of 2% by 2027. The IMF urged Japan to continue raising interest rates to a neutral level and explicitly warned the Japanese government against cutting the consumption tax, arguing that this would erode fiscal space and increase debt risks. This statement reinforced market expectations that the Bank of Japan will gradually withdraw its ultra-loose monetary policy.
- **References**:
  - [1] [IMF](https://www.imf.org/en/news/articles/2026/02/18/tr-02162026-imf-japan-aiv-press-conference)

### 12. Emerging Markets Outlook 2026: Expected to Continue Leading Global Growth
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: 世界银行, IMF, 德尔福斯
- **Summary**: According to the latest analysis by Delphi and the World Bank, emerging markets are projected to perform strongly in 2026, with growth rates expected to reach 3.3% to 4%, significantly higher than the 1.5% growth rate of developed economies. India, Southeast Asia, and Central Europe are becoming hotspots for global capital inflows. Driven by strong domestic demand and the expansion of digital ecosystems, global capital is pouring into these assets at the fastest pace since 2009. Despite lingering geopolitical and trade tariff risks, emerging economies have demonstrated remarkable resilience through improvements in their policy frameworks, offsetting some of the weakness in traditional markets.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Delphos](https://delphos.co/news/blog/emerging-markets-2026-outlook-strategies-for-impact-investors/)

### 13. BIS Report: Differences in AI readiness could widen global wealth gap
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: 国际清算银行 (BIS)
- **Summary**: According to our report, the Bank for International Settlements (BIS) recently released a report indicating that the impact of artificial intelligence on productivity varies from country to country. Currently, developed economies hold a significant advantage in AI infrastructure and talent reserves, while emerging markets, due to technological barriers and structural bottlenecks, may face the risk of falling behind in this round of technological revolution. The report warns that AI technology could become a key factor further widening the growth gap between emerging markets and between emerging and developed economies, and that countries must accelerate domestic reforms to maintain competitiveness.
- **References**:
  - [1] [BIS / Khan](https://www.khan.co.kr/en/article/202602191644007)

### 14. Nigeria speaks out at the Al-Ula conference: Seeking a fairer global economic decision-making process.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: The Digger News
- **Summary**: According to The Diggers News, at the Al-Ula Conference in Saudi Arabia, the Nigerian government clearly expressed its ambition to reshape the global economic order. The Nigerian representative pointed out that while emerging economies are making an increasing contribution to global growth, they remain marginalized within the existing decision-making system. Nigeria is accelerating its shift towards cooperation with Gulf states, seeking a more equitable voice in addressing global changes. This move reflects a trend of global economic power shifting from a traditional Western-centric model towards multipolarity.
- **References**:
  - [1] [The Digger News](https://www.thediggernews.com/2026/02/19/nigeria-turns-to-gulf-nations-for-fairer-global-economic-order/)

### 15. Escalating tensions in the Middle East and between Russia and Ukraine have pushed Brent crude oil back above $70.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: Economies.com, Trading Economics
- **Summary**: International oil prices surged on February 19th due to a sharp rise in geopolitical risks. Brent crude oil futures for April settled at $70.35 per barrel, a single-day increase of over 4%. Reports indicate that increased risks of conflict between the US and Iran, along with stalled progress in Russia-Ukraine peace talks, were the main reasons for the price spike. The US government stated that Iran had not met its demands in nuclear negotiations and reserved the right to use force. This series of tensions has once again caused geopolitical premiums to dominate the energy market, triggering deep concerns among investors about supply security.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Trading Economics](https://tradingeconomics.com/commodity/crude-oil)
  - [2] [Economies.com](https://www.economies.com/forex/gbp-usd-news/sterling-skids-to-four-week-trough-on-uk-rates-48328)

### 16. Tektronix is accelerating its merger with Anglo American to create a new global mining leader.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: Stockwatch
- **Summary**: According to Stockwatch, Canadian mining giant Teck Resources released its Q4 2025 financial results and announced significant progress in its merger with Anglo American. This merger aims to create a global leader in key minerals to address the enormous resource demands brought about by the energy transition. The report shows that despite macroeconomic volatility, the company maintained strong growth in Q4. Meanwhile, another mining company, Sandfire Resources, also achieved record revenue driven by commodity prices, demonstrating the continued momentum of consolidation and expansion in the mining sector.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Stockwatch](https://www.stockwatch.com/News/Item/Z-C!TECK-3786485/C/TECK)

### 17. Indonesia is cautious about the US-India trade agreement, with a focus on energy pricing security.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: 雅加达邮报, The Star
- **Summary**: According to the Jakarta Post, on the eve of the signing of a bilateral tariff agreement between Indonesia and the United States, Indonesian economists publicly called on the government to remain highly vigilant. Experts pointed out that Indonesia must pay close attention to the pricing details of US energy and agricultural products to avoid being forced to accept non-competitive high prices. Meanwhile, the president of Mitsubishi Electric Power Asia Pacific also stated that Indonesia's power sector is addressing growing demand through gas and hydrogen energy technologies. Finding a balance between energy security, decarbonization goals, and fair trade has become a key focus for the Indonesian government.
- **References**:
  - [1] [The Jakarta Post](https://www.thejakartapost.com/business/2026/02/19/executive-column-mitsubishi-power-bets-on-efficient-baseload-amid-net-zero-target.html)

### 18. Geopolitical premiums for precious metals have declined, and gold and silver prices have entered a period of consolidation.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Investing.com
- **Summary**: According to Investing.com analysis, after a rally driven by tariffs and geopolitical concerns, gold and silver futures have recently entered a phase of "geopolitical premium cleansing." Data from February 18th shows that gold prices are releasing previously accumulated pressure. Analysts point out that as the market reassesses expectations of interest rate cuts, precious metals will likely consolidate in the short term. However, from a long-term perspective, silver is expected to outperform gold in the coming years, and the current correction is seen by some investors as a window of opportunity for long-term positioning.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Investing.com](https://ca.investing.com/analysis/gold-and-silver-flush-geopolitical-premium-as-accumulation-window-opens-200622202)

### 19. The India AI Impact Summit was held, driving a steady rise in the banking and metals sectors.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Enrich Money
- **Summary**: Reports indicate that the Indian financial market performed steadily, boosted by the ongoing "India AI Impact Summit." Investors hold a structurally optimistic view of AI infrastructure development, a sentiment that directly supported the continued rise in the banking and metals sectors. Although some IT software companies faced pressure due to concerns about potential industry disruption from AI, the overall market steadily climbed, driven by banking and raw material stocks, demonstrating the Indian capital market's high expectations for emerging technology infrastructure.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Enrich Money](https://enrichmoney.in/bank-nifty-news-research-analysis-chart)

### 20. Goods supplies were plentiful during the Vietnamese Lunar New Year, and market prices remained stable.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: Vietnam.vn
- **Summary**: According to a report from Vietnam's Ministry of Industry and Trade, the domestic commodity market in Vietnam operated smoothly on the third day of the Lunar New Year (Year of the Horse). As residents were mainly busy visiting relatives and friends, the supply of daily necessities was ample, and there were no instances of soaring prices or shortages. The report also mentioned that Shanghai has become a popular destination for South Korean tourists during this year's Lunar New Year. The entire Southeast Asian region demonstrated strong consumer spending and stable supply chain management capabilities amidst the festive atmosphere.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Vietnam.vn](https://www.vietnam.vn/en/thi-truong-hang-hoa-mung-3-tet-binh-ngo-nguon-cung-doi-dao-gia-on-dinh)
